snippet: U.S. officials said the bank illegally signed documents without verifying data and provided inaccurate information to third-party debt collectors.
abstract: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau says JPMorgan Chase will pay $136 million to settle charges that it used illegal methods to pursue delinquent credit card borrowers.
lead_paragraph: U.S. officials said the bank illegally signed documents without verifying data and provided inaccurate information to third-party debt collectors.

headline.main: JPMorgan to Pay $136 Million to Settle Debt Collection Case
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Settles Case on Collection of Bad Debts
